alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 12:22PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Douglas. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 PM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding at the Cowskin Creek low water crossing at Highway Y west of Ava due to run off from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. An additional round of rainfall from this afternoon into tonight could lead to additional rainfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches across the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Cowskin Creek at County Road 514, Bryant Creek at Highway U and Cowskin Creek at Highway Y. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ava and Dogwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
